summary: Each year, more than 12,000 newborns are diagnosed with conditions that can cause severe disability or death if not treated quickly. To screen for such conditions, health care providers collect blood samples from newborns and send them to labs for testing. However, states face barriers to timely screening—such as issues with sending samples to labs—that can delay treatment. Most states had not yet met their...
title: Newborn Screening Timeliness: Most States Had Not Met Screening Goals, but Some Are Developing Strategies to Address Barriers
